column4: Hi, I upgraded Ubuntu server from 10.10 to 11.04 and now it won't boot, or even display the grub menu. It goes straight to a grub (grub>) command line interface where I can't even boot anything successfully
I ran the boot_information_script and got this output: http://pastebin.com/mfuNvv7r
But the filesystem actually is ext4
Are you using an old liveCD without ext4 support?
Actually yes. But just downloaded a newer version so I guess the info is more useful from there
I've got a new result file in http://pastebin.com/VtuQk6vV
Can you be on IRC and at the grub shell at the same time (on a different computer)?
Yes
Ok. Please reboot to the grub shell and tell me when you are there.
I'm there
What is the output of "echo $prefix"?
(hd0,msdos1)/boot/grub
What is the output of "ls $prefix/grub.cfg"?
grub.fg (it's there)
And BTW there's a new version of the Boot info script results (I installed lzma) at: http://pastebin.com/LEp3sKv6
What happens if you run "configfile $prefix/grub.cfg"?
The screen clears?
If you press escape do you see a menu?
Nope, just gives me a new input prompt in the console (grub>)
Thank you very much for your help so far, do you have any further ideas for me to try
Try asking in #grub.
Thanks
You're welcome.
